means: 美国肖肖尼族印第安人，肖肖尼语
(pl.Shoshone,Shoshones)肖松尼族人（美国西部的一种印第安人）

sentence.Network_en: There he met the famous Shoshone chieftain Washakie.
sentence.Network_cn: 在那里他碰到了著名的绍山酋长华谢基.

sentence.Network_en: In August 1805 Lewis and Clark were looking for the Shoshone Indians.
sentence.Network_cn: 1805年8月时,路易斯和克拉克正在找寻休休尼族印地安人.

sentence.Network_en: Many other famous Indian tribes lived here too - the Blackfeet, the Crow , the Shoshone.
sentence.Network_cn: 其他许多著名的印第安部落也生活在这里 —— 黑脚部族 、 鸦部族和肖松尼部族.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of the North American Indian people (related to the Aztecs) of the southwestern United States
2. the language spoken by the Shoshone people (belonging to the Uto-Aztecan family)
